intro: Eremopyrum cristatum, commonly known as the crested wheatgrass, is a perennial grass native to the arid and semi-arid regions of central Asia. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and distinctive, often branched inflorescence that gives it its common name. The plant has narrow, bluish-green leaves and produces small, spike-like flowers that are typically green to yellowish in color. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems that help it survive in dry conditions. Eremopyrum cristatum is often used for erosion control and as a forage crop in regions with low rainfall.
